verses.kjv: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed thing: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against the children of Israel.
verses.web: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the devoted things; for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things. Therefore LORD’s anger burned against the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But the people of Israel broke faith with God regarding the things that were set apart for destruction. A man named Achan — son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah — took some of those forbidden items for himself. Because of this, the LORD's anger burned against all of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Bethaven, on the east side of Bethel, and spake unto them, saying, Go up and view the country.  And the men went up and viewed Ai.
verses.web: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth Aven, on the east side of Bethel, and spoke to them, saying, “Go up and spy out the land.” The men went up and spied out Ai.
verses.ct: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, a city near Bethaven, east of Bethel. He told them, "Go scout out the land." So the men went and surveyed Ai.

verses.kjv: And they returned to Joshua, and said unto him, Let not all the people go up; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai; and make not all the people to labour thither; for they are but few.
verses.web: They returned to Joshua, and said to him, “Don’t let all the people go up, but let about two or three thousand men go up and strike Ai. Don’t make all the people to toil there, for there are only a few of them.”
verses.ct: When they came back, they reported to Joshua, "There's no need to send the whole army. Ai is small — just send 2 or 3 thousand men to attack it. Don't wear out the entire force for such a minor target."

verses.kjv: So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.
verses.web: So about three thousand men of the people went up there, and they fled before the men of Ai.
verses.ct: So about 3,000 Israelite soldiers marched up to Ai — and they were routed. They fled from the men of Ai.

verses.kjv: And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty and six men: for they chased them from before the gate even unto Shebarim, and smote them in the going down: wherefore the hearts of the people melted, and became as water.
verses.web: The men of Ai struck about thirty-six men of them. They chased them from before the gate even to Shebarim, and struck them at the descent. The hearts of the people melted, and became like water.
verses.ct: The men of Ai killed about 36 Israelites, chasing them from the city gate all the way to Shebarim and cutting them down on the slopes. When the rest of Israel heard what happened, their courage melted away like water.

verses.kjv: And Joshua rent his clothes, and fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of the LORD until the eventide, he and the elders of Israel, and put dust upon their heads.
verses.web: Joshua tore his clothes, and fell to the earth on his face before LORD’s ark until the evening, he and the elders of Israel; and they put dust on their heads.
verses.ct: Joshua tore his clothes and fell facedown on the ground before the ark of the LORD, staying there until evening. The elders of Israel did the same, and they all threw dust on their heads in grief.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said, Alas, O LORD God, wherefore hast thou at all brought this people over Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us? would to God we had been content, and dwelt on the other side Jordan!
verses.web: Joshua said, “Alas, Lord LORD, why have you brought this people over the Jordan at all, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to cause us to perish? I wish that we had been content and lived beyond the Jordan!
verses.ct: Joshua cried out, "Lord GOD, why did you bring us across the Jordan at all? Was it just to hand us over to the Amorites and let them destroy us? If only we had been satisfied to stay on the other side of the Jordan!"

verses.kjv: O LORD, what shall I say, when Israel turneth their backs before their enemies!
verses.web: Oh, Lord, what shall I say, after Israel has turned their backs before their enemies?
verses.ct: "LORD, what can I even say now that Israel has turned and run from its enemies?"

verses.kjv: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land shall hear of it, and shall environ us round, and cut off our name from the earth: and what wilt thou do unto thy great name?
verses.web: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it, and will surround us, and cut off our name from the earth. What will you do for your great name?”
verses.ct: "When the Canaanites and everyone else in this land hear about this, they'll surround us and wipe our name off the face of the earth. Then what will happen to your great name?"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Get thee up; wherefore liest thou thus upon thy face?
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Get up! Why have you fallen on your face like that?
verses.ct: The LORD said to Joshua, "Stand up! Why are you lying facedown like this?"

verses.kjv: Israel hath sinned, and they have also transgressed my covenant which I commanded them: for they have even taken of the accursed thing, and have also stolen, and dissembled also, and they have put it even among their own stuff.
verses.web: Israel has sinned. Yes, they have even transgressed my covenant which I commanded them. Yes, they have even taken some of the devoted things, and have also stolen, and also deceived. They have even put it among their own stuff.
verses.ct: "Israel has sinned. They have broken the covenant I commanded them to keep. They took items that were set apart for destruction. They stole them, they lied about it, and they hid them among their own belongings."

verses.kjv: Therefore the children of Israel could not stand before their enemies, but turned their backs before their enemies, because they were accursed: neither will I be with you any more, except ye destroy the accursed from among you.
verses.web: Therefore the children of Israel can’t stand before their enemies. They turn their backs before their enemies, because they have become devoted for destruction. I will not be with you any more, unless you destroy the devoted things from among you.
verses.ct: "That is why the Israelites can't stand against their enemies — they turn and run because they themselves have become contaminated by what was set apart for destruction. I will not be with you anymore unless you remove this forbidden thing from among you."

verses.kjv: Up, sanctify the people, and say, Sanctify yourselves against to morrow: for thus saith the LORD God of Israel, There is an accursed thing in the midst of thee, O Israel: thou canst not stand before thine enemies, until ye take away the accursed thing from among you.
verses.web: Get up! Sanctify the people, and say, ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, for LORD, the God of Israel, says, “There is a devoted thing among you, Israel. You cannot stand before your enemies until you take away the devoted thing from among you.”
verses.ct: "Get up! Consecrate the people and tell them, 'Purify yourselves for tomorrow, because the LORD, the God of Israel, says: There is something set apart for destruction hidden among you, Israel. You will not be able to stand against your enemies until you remove it.'"

verses.kjv: In the morning therefore ye shall be brought according to your tribes: and it shall be, that the tribe which the LORD taketh shall come according to the families thereof; and the family which the LORD shall take shall come by households; and the household which the LORD shall take shall come man by man.
verses.web: In the morning therefore you shall be brought near by your tribes. It shall be that the tribe which LORD selects shall come near by families. The family which LORD selects shall come near by households. The household which LORD selects shall come near man by man.
verses.ct: "Tomorrow morning, you will come forward tribe by tribe. The tribe the LORD selects will come forward clan by clan. The clan the LORD selects will come forward household by household. The household the LORD selects will come forward man by man."

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that he that is taken with the accursed thing shall be burnt with fire, he and all that he hath: because he hath transgressed the covenant of the LORD, and because he hath wrought folly in Israel.
verses.web: It shall be, that he who is taken with the devoted thing shall be burned with fire, he and all that he has, because he has transgressed LORD’s covenant, and because he has done a disgraceful thing in Israel.’ ”
verses.ct: "Whoever is found with the forbidden items will be burned with fire — him and everything he owns — because he broke the LORD's covenant and committed a disgraceful act in Israel."

verses.kjv: So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel by their tribes; and the tribe of Judah was taken:
verses.web: So Joshua rose up early in the morning and brought Israel near by their tribes. The tribe of Judah was selected.
verses.ct: Joshua got up early the next morning and had Israel come forward tribe by tribe. The tribe of Judah was selected.

verses.kjv: And he brought the family of Judah; and he took the family of the Zarhites: and he brought the family of the Zarhites man by man; and Zabdi was taken:
verses.web: He brought near the family of Judah, and he selected the family of the Zerahites. He brought near the family of the Zerahites man by man, and Zabdi was selected.
verses.ct: He brought the clans of Judah forward, and the clan of the Zarhites was selected. He brought the Zarhite clan forward man by man, and Zabdi was selected.

verses.kjv: And he brought his household man by man; and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
verses.web: He brought near his household man by man, and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was selected.
verses.ct: He brought Zabdi's household forward man by man, and Achan — son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah — was selected.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto Achan, My son, give, I pray thee, glory to the LORD God of Israel, and make confession unto him; and tell me now what thou hast done; hide it not from me.
verses.web: Joshua said to Achan, “My son, please give glory to LORD, the God of Israel, and make confession to him. Tell me now what you have done! Don’t hide it from me!”
verses.ct: Joshua said to Achan, "My son, give glory to the LORD, the God of Israel, and confess to him. Tell me what you've done. Don't hide anything from me."

verses.kjv: And Achan answered Joshua, and said, Indeed I have sinned against the LORD God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done:
verses.web: Achan answered Joshua, and said, “I have truly sinned against LORD, the God of Israel, and this is what I have done.
verses.ct: Achan answered Joshua, "It's true — I have sinned against the LORD, the God of Israel. Here is what I did:

verses.kjv: When I saw among the spoils a goodly Babylonish garment, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.
verses.web: When I saw among the plunder a beautiful Babylonian robe, two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, then I coveted them and took them. Behold, they are hidden in the ground in the middle of my tent, with the silver under it.”
verses.ct: "Among the plunder I spotted a beautiful Babylonian robe, 200 shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing 50 shekels. I wanted them so badly that I took them. They're buried in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath."

verses.kjv: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent; and, behold, it was hid in his tent, and the silver under it.
verses.web: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent. Behold, it was hidden in his tent, with the silver under it.
verses.ct: Joshua sent messengers running to Achan's tent, and sure enough, the items were hidden there in the ground with the silver underneath.

verses.kjv: And they took them out of the midst of the tent, and brought them unto Joshua, and unto all the children of Israel, and laid them out before the LORD.
verses.web: They took them from the middle of the tent, and brought them to Joshua and to all the children of Israel. They laid them down before LORD.
verses.ct: They pulled everything out of the tent and brought it all to Joshua and the entire assembly of Israel, spreading it out before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, and the silver, and the garment, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his asses, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had: and they brought them unto the valley of Achor.
verses.web: Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the wedge of gold, his sons, his daughters, his cattle, his donkeys, his sheep, his tent, and all that he had; and they brought them up to the valley of Achor.
verses.ct: Then Joshua and all of Israel took Achan son of Zerah, along with the silver, the robe, the gold wedge, his sons, his daughters, his cattle, his donkeys, his sheep, his tent, and everything he owned, and brought them all to the Valley of Achor.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said, Why hast thou troubled us? the LORD shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones, and burned them with fire, after they had stoned them with stones.
verses.web: Joshua said, “Why have you troubled us? LORD will trouble you today.” All Israel stoned him with stones, and they burned them with fire and stoned them with stones.
verses.ct: Joshua said, "Why have you brought this disaster on us? Today the LORD will bring disaster on you." Then all of Israel stoned him, and they burned everything with fire and stoned them with stones.

verses.kjv: And they raised over him a great heap of stones unto this day. So the LORD turned from the fierceness of his anger. Wherefore the name of that place was called, The valley of Achor, unto this day.
verses.web: They raised over him a great heap of stones that remains to this day. LORD turned from the fierceness of his anger. Therefore the name of that place was called “The valley of Achor” to this day.
verses.ct: They piled a large mound of stones over him that stands to this day. Then the LORD turned from his fierce anger. That is why the place has been called the Valley of Achor — which means "trouble" — to this day.
